Class Name: Instructional and Assistive Technology in a Universally Designed Learning Environment
PreReqs: Prerequisite: Admission to Teacher Education Program.

Description: Field experience for the implementation of Literacy courses concepts.

PreReqs: Corequisites: EL 314; EL 317. Prerequisites: CF 120 or PY 120 with minimum grade of C; ED 280 with minimum grade of B; LI 243; Admission to Teacher Education program.
Description: This course develops knowledge and skills in emergent and early literacy instruction.

PreReqs: Corequisites: EL 314; EL 316. Prerequisites: PY 120 or CF 120; ED 280; LI 243; and admission to Teacher Education Program. (3)
Description: This course develops knowledge and skills in methods of teaching literacy and lesson plan design.

Class Name: Language Development of Children with Exceptionalities
PreReqs: Prerequisites: Admission into the Teacher Education Program; EX 311 or EX 390.
Description: Emphasizing typical and atypical language acquisition and instructional strategies/technologies for students with with Exceptional Learning Needs.

PreReqs: Prerequisites: Admission into the Teacher Prep Program; EX 311. Corequisite: EX 302.
Description: Theoretical background and rationale for managing student behavior. Emphasizes the elements of primary, secondary, and tertiary interventions.

Class Name: Methods of Teaching Math/Science/Social Studies in EC & EE
PreReqs: Co-requisites: CE 330; CE 365; CE 366. Prerequisite: CE 370; UI 308; Admission to the Teacher Education Program.
Description: Research based strategies for implementation of integrated Math, Science, Social Studies curriculum in ECE/Elem. Ed.

PreReqs: Corequisites: CE 330; CE 364; CE 366. Prerequisites: Admission to the Teacher Education Program. (3)
Description: Study of observational assessment methods, standardized testing, and the application of data to design instruction to support development and learning

PreReqs: Corequisite: CE 330; CE 364; CE 365; CE 366. Prerequisites: CF 285; Admission to the Teacher Education Program. (2)
Description: Integration of appropriately designed field experiences in a Pre-K setting with early childhood course work, 75 hours in the field

Class Name: Diagnosis and Remediation of Math Difficulties
PreReqs: Prerequisites: Admission to the Teacher Education Program; EX 311 or EX 390; MA 228. (3).
Description: Provides knowledge in use of diagnostic/prescriptive approach involving research-supported teaching/learning strategies when providing mathematics instruction to students with mild/moderate disabilities.

Class Name: Assessment and Techniques of Teaching Children with Exceptionalities
PreReqs: Prerequisites: Admission to the Teacher Education Program; EX 311. (3).
Description: Introduction/application of assessment/evaluation processes and application of information in the development of Individualized Education Programs.

Class Name: Strategies and Techniques with a Learning Theory Base for Teaching Mild/Moderate Cross-Categorical
PreReqs: Prerequisites: EX 311; Admission to the Teacher Education Program.
Description: Strategies/techniques for teaching students with mild/moderate disabilities K-12 cross-categorical settings emphasizing educational learning theory based academic, perceptual and cognitive skills.

PreReqs: X
Description: A study of the social and legal issues that influence public K-12 education.

Class Name: Meeting the Needs of Struggling Readers

PreReqs: Prerequisites: EL 314; EL 316; EL 317. (3).
Description: Teaching literacy skills in various disciplines and content areas (listening, speaking, viewing, and visual representing) leading to enhanced student outcomes.

Class Name: Advanced Field Experience in the Education of Students with Exceptionalities in Elementary Settings
PreReqs: Prerequisites: EX 302; EX 304; EX 305; EX 311; EX 312; EX 317; EX 373. Co-requisites: EL 354; EL 420;
Description: Integration of appropriately designed field experiences commensurate with Education of Children with Exceptionalities Teacher Preparation Program coursework in elementary education

Class Name: Families and the Child with Exceptionalities
PreReqs: Prerequisites: Admission to Teacher Education program; EX 311; or consent of instructor. (3).
Description: Emphasizes the teacher of children with exceptionalities partnering with families. Stresses collaborating with families, and strategies for accessing community resources.
